com.threerings.media.util
Class MathUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.threerings.media.util.MathUtil

public class MathUtil
extends Object

Provides miscellaneous useful utility routines for mathematical calculations.

ellipseCircum

public static double ellipseCircum(double a,
                                   double b)
Returns the approximate circumference of the ellipse defined by the specified minor and major axes. The formula used (due to Ramanujan, via a paper of his entitled "Modular Equations and Approximations to Pi"), is Pi(3a + 3b - sqrt[(a+3b)(b+3a)]).

sign

public static int sign(int value)
Returns positive 1 if the sign of the argument is positive, or -1 if the sign of the argument is negative.

floorDiv

public static int floorDiv(int dividend,
                           int divisor)
Computes the floored division dividend/divisor which is useful when dividing potentially negative numbers into bins.

For example, the following numbers floorDiv 10 are: 

 -15 -10 -8 -2 0 2 8 10 15
  -2  -1 -1 -1 0 0 0  1  1

stddev

public static float[] stddev(int[] values,
                             int start,
                             int length)
Computes the standard deviation of the supplied values.

Returns:
an array of three values: the mean, variance and standard deviation, in that order.

choose

public static int choose(int n,
                         int k)
Computes (N choose K), the number of ways to select K different elements from a set of size N.
